comment: Professor Sleep is the man! He is one of the best professors I have had at KSU. He uses humor and personal stories to help teach you all the basics of the sales world. His in-class activities are fun and make you want to participate. The exams aren't too bad, the final is 3 short essay questions about a book we had to read during the semester.

Sleep is very nice and understanding! Don't buy the textbook, he gives you everything you'll need for the class in person. Tests are simple and straightforward; the final is based on a book that you'll need to read but it's not bad. There are many selling activities; I wish the class was a bit more focused more on marketing but it wasn't bad.
Very funny and great at teaching sales
One of the best professors Ive ever had

There were a lot of role-play/presentation-type assignments and those were pretty annoying & challenging, however other than that the class was great and I would definitely recommend taking Stefan Sleep. It'd be nice if the class was geared a little more towards marketing majors or included options for introverts, but in general, it was good.
He gives exam review guides and don't buy the textbook (you won't need it). If you show up and follow his instructions, you will get an A. Take him if you can.

10/10 recommend this professor. Posts exam reviews so you know exactly what to study for the test. Go to class. Course is not challenging as long as you show up to class. There are various in-class activities and 4 role plays throughout the semester. Expectations are clear.

comment: Great professor, does weekly lectures to help understand the course material. You will be partnered with someone and will have to do role-plays with them. Prepare to come out of your comfort zone, but the class is not difficult.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria
